# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = Vector{String}()
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= word * ' '
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)  # Add any remaining text to the last line
    return join(lines, "\n")    # Join all lines with a newline character
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped into multiple lines."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

Output:
```
This is a very
long sentence that
should be wrapped
into multiple lines.
```
